name: TheAtlantic
text: "Given a rare chance to see the president at length, without filters or interruptions (except many of his own), many Americans looked at Trump and recoiled in horror," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/YJVvVd1NiJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Senators grapple with the reality that they have destroyed their own house, @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/EXTdaiGmTt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When we consider how the postelection interregnum will go, we should remember that Trump had a vision of the presidency that began with extreme laziness, and that the end of his presidency could go roughly the same way," @gcaw writes: https://t.co/fYeeCQ4sSp

name: TheAtlantic
text: With each dismissive comment he makes about his own experience with COVID-19, Trump minimizes the suffering of an ever-growing share of Americans, @elainejgodfrey reports: https://t.co/cRSeNwv8Xk

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Poll work is hard, undercompensated, and uncelebrated, with a too-limited pool of recruits," @JudithShulevitz writes: https://t.co/bAQd4U8eeP

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump’s refusal to condemn QAnon was a shock, but not a surprise, @russellberman writes: https://t.co/LFg7BJTiWK

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JohnGHendy: Trump rode one conspiracy (birtherism) to a first term. He's now trying to ride an even worse one to his second. 

Trump refuses to condemn QAnon because he knows Q believers are his base. 

https://t.co/QcnuQkywNh via @russellberman

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: “It’s tempting to conclude that Trump simply doesn’t know the difference. But that would overly charitable... He’s a politician who caters to his base, who doesn’t dare alienate the people who put him in office, and who he needs to salvage a second term.” https://t.co/2ZNjZWGwRp

name: TheAtlantic
text: The data this week make it clear: The U.S. is once again in the clutches of a surging pandemic, @COVID19Tracking reports. https://t.co/5vsSjEinSY

name: TheAtlantic
text: Reddit was the first platform to get rid of QAnon. If there's anything to be learned from how the company did it, it's that it might be the last platform as well, @kait_tiffany reports. https://t.co/w5JmPdLUou

name: TheAtlantic
text: We are likely closer to the beginning of QAnon's story than the end. To look at the group,  @AdrienneLaF wrote in our June cover story, is to see not just a conspiracy theory but the birth of a new religion. https://t.co/vgn2zf5sjp

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: .⁦@russellberman⁩: “Once again, the president could not bring himself to criticize a group, however large or small, that provides him loyal support.” https://t.co/LZm6bkC332

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When senators and the nominee herself talk about stare decisis, they are deploying something like a secret code—a shorthand for how to interpret specific, explosive decisions," @maryrziegler writes: https://t.co/0KcKSESIct

name: TheAtlantic
text: Playing an instrument during the pandemic is not absolutely risk-free, but if you keep a few things in mind, it could be close. @JamesHamblin reports: https://t.co/EuFzGWVblb

name: TheAtlantic
text: Nikon has announced the winners of the 2020 Small World Photomicrography Competition, which invites photographers and scientists to submit images of all things visible under a microscope—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/oF1hd3uYyC

name: TheAtlantic
text: Nikon has announced the winners of the 2020 Small World Photomicrography Competition, which invites photographers and scientists to submit images of all things visible under a microscope—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/gWGJjKbSpd

name: TheAtlantic
text: Endia Beal’s photographs explore how race, gender, and work intersect, with a particular focus on the lives of Black women, @imaniperry writes. https://t.co/KcNXESWKKZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Meet the Milk Tea Alliance, the very online grouping that is emblematic of the frustration many young people feel toward Beijing’s grating assertiveness in Asia. @TMcLaughlin3 reports: https://t.co/RFY9BSEcl4

name: TheAtlantic
text: If intellectual meandering is key to real learning, why not embrace distraction—even in class? @lilyjmeyer considers the pandemic-era lecture: https://t.co/ET8tVwwt82

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Yesterday, Amy Coney Barrett answered “the question that has defined her nomination”—with a nonanswer. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: 
https://t.co/2xMliL5zU4

name: TheAtlantic
text: Meet the Milk Tea Alliance, the very online grouping that is emblematic of the frustration many young people feel toward Beijing’s grating assertiveness in Asia. @TMcLaughlin3 reports: https://t.co/fqiHcmJLz7
